snippet: King Digital Entertainment, which went public in March, reported revenue of $594 million for the second quarter ended June 30 compared with $456 million in the year-ago period.
abstract: King Digital Entertainment reports lower-than-expected second-quarter revenue; company reports revenue of $594 million for second quarter ended June 30 compared with $456 million in year-ago period.
lead_paragraph: King Digital Entertainment, which went public in March, reported revenue of $594 million for the second quarter ended June 30 compared with $456 million in the year-ago period.

headline.main: Revenue Disappoints at Maker of Candy Crush Saga
headline.print_headline: Revenue Disappoints at Maker of Candy Crush Saga
